image.altText: A group of primary aged kids in school uniforms walking on a red dirt road.

props.synopsis: Truancy officers have begun patrols in the NT, trying to get children to school and issuing fines and compliance notices to families who fail to comply.

title.children: ‘A direct attack on our rights’: Outcry over new NT policy to fine parents of truant children

image.altText: Becc and Nathan look out to their backyard. Becc is wearing a "Just Married" jacket, lifting a wine bottle up with one arm..

props.synopsis: Becc and Nathan asked their friend to marry them. Months later, they discovered their 'perfect' wedding wasn't what it seemed.

title.children: A Melbourne couple had a 'perfect' wedding. Then they found out their celebrant deceived them

image.altText: A teenage boy in a white hoodie and black baseball cap

props.synopsis: The prosecution argued the four co-accused had formed a "common purpose" to kill Kingsley Alley in the early hours of October 8, 2022, while the defence accused prosecutors of "cherry-picking" evidence.

title.children: Murder trial of four people accused of killing 18-year-old in Darwin driveway hears closing arguments

image.altText: An aerial shot of a drilling site in the Beetaloo Basin. Machinery and vehicles are in a land clearing surrounded by trees,

props.synopsis: Traditional owners say they were not adequately consulted before the NT government signed off on Empire Energy's plan to drill nine new gas wells in the Beetaloo Basin.

title.children: 'It is insulting': Native title holders claim inadequate consultation before Beetaloo fracking plan approved

image.altText: Man holding a long gun in front of pink building.

props.synopsis: The suspect allegedly forced a pub patron to drive him almost 300 kilometres before he was apprehended by police.

title.children: CCTV shows outback pub kidnapping suspect throw pair of firearms down before arrest

image.altText: A doctor holds a stethoscope in two clasped hands

props.synopsis: Australia's second-largest private hospital operator has announced it will terminate its contracts with two major private health insurers.

title.children: Australia's second-largest private hospital operator to rip up contracts with two major insurers

image.altText: a woman with blonde hair looking serious

props.synopsis: Women are the fastest growing cohort of prisoners in the NT. But with domestic violence one of the main drivers of female offending, some experts say many of the women being locked up, shouldn't be behind bars at all.

title.children: 'Well-intentioned' policies landing women in prison 'pressure cooker' of trauma and depression

image.altText: An empty hospital bed with white sheets next to a red armchair and turquoise blue curtains

props.synopsis: The private health cover of millions of Bupa and Australian Health Services Alliance customers will be impacted by Healthscope's planned contract cuts, but the Insurance Ombudsman suggests patients with pre-booked care shouldn't face out-of-pocket costs.

title.children: Patients who will pay more for hospital care due to planned ending of Healthscope contracts and those who will not

image.altText: two chinese men standing next to each other with their faces blurred

props.synopsis: An Indigenous ranger group that rescued four asylum seekers on a remote island off the Northern Territory coast last week is calling for the federal government to guarantee their safety.

title.children: 'He said if he's sent back to China, he'll be killed': Rangers question future of asylum seekers found in remote NT

image.altText: Steve Smith is stuck on the crease, leaning and reaching forward after the ball hit him on the pad

props.synopsis: At the beginning of a summer to be defined by legends in the twilights of their career, the last thing Australia needed was the kind of batting collapse it hoped had been banished to a bygone era.

title.children: Australia collapses into a batting crisis as Test legends confront their waning powers

image.altText: Sunset overt he plains at Cohuna, Victoria with a solo tree standing in the distance

props.synopsis: The thundery finish to spring is not just random weather variability, but a likely indication of the probable weather patterns through December.

title.children: Major storm outbreak across Australia to follow hottest spring weather in up to 42 years

image.altText: Laken Riley stands and smiles, with hands on hips, on a lawn with buildings in the background.

props.synopsis: A young American nursing student was attacked and killed by an undocumented immigrant during her morning jog. Her name was made into a campaign cry for Donald Trump's mass deportation policy.

title.children: 'Say her name': How a nursing student's murder was made into a MAGA campaign cry

image.altText: A close up image of a woman with black hair and ear peircing

props.synopsis: Ms Shaked, a right-wing politician who left parliament in 2022, had applied to attend a security conference in Canberra and other events organised by the Australia/Israel and Jewish Affairs Council.

title.children: Australia denies visa for Israel's former justice minister Ayelet Shaked

image.altText: A woman holding a picture of her home

props.synopsis: The Cornish-Templeton family has lived in Melbourne for decades, with each member's journey to buying a home becoming more difficult.

title.children: Three generations of this family tell the story of Australia's soaring house prices

image.altText: Clouds cover the peak of a mountain on an island.

props.synopsis: The cloud forest at the top of Lord Howe Island's highest peak is an otherworldly place alive with animals and plants not found anywhere else on Earth. But it's taken radical action to save it.

title.children: After eradicating more than 300,000 mice and rats, Lord Howe's cloud forest is bouncing back

image.altText: The front of an Aldi supermarket is seen from inside a shopping trolley

props.synopsis: Woolworths and Coles are emphasising the threat of Aldi — is it really a competitive force to be reckoned with? A supermarket inquiry will determine just that, among other competition concerns.

title.children: The Aldi effect: How the supermarket chain is catching up with the 'big two'

image.altText: A large ballistic missile taking off from a launch site in the middle of a Russian forest.

props.synopsis: The missile struck a military warehouse in the early hours of Thursday morning, sparking condemnation from world leaders who labelled the move as an escalation.

title.children: Ukraine says new Russian missile travelled at over 13,000km/h as NATO holds emergency meeting

image.altText: Conor McGregor arriving at court in a dark suit and tie.

props.synopsis: Nikita Hand alleged McGregor, one of the world's highest paid athletes, sexually assaulted her in a Dublin hotel room in December 2018 after a Christmas party.

title.children: Jury finds MMA star Conor McGregor sexually assaulted Nikita Hand in 2018 in civil case

image.altText: Hands holding up a blow up globe ball

props.synopsis: The COP29 climate summit in Azerbaijan ran into overtime, which is not unusual, as a draft deal requiring developed nations to pay more drew criticism.

title.children: 'Like haggling in the fish market': COP29 $385 billion draft deal stalls as wealthy nations resist the cost

image.altText: Actress Cynthia Ervio poses for a photo in front of a green 'Wicked' poster wearing an elegant black frock

props.synopsis: I am delighted and creatively stimulated by the brilliance of Cynthia Erivo's frock: a mad folly of extraordinary craft, labour and money that will be worn only once, but will live on in memory and in the diffusion of its aesthetic down through the more affordable items we will be buying next.

title.children: I want the Australian fashion industry to survive. But the making of clothes is a morally fraught concept

image.altText: Dad with son outside

props.synopsis: The "your body, my choice" movement is sweeping the world. What can parents do to raise healthy, confident boys?

title.children: Raising boys in an era of ‘your body, my choice’ rhetoric starts early. Here’s how

image.altText: A man in a colourful t-shirt stands in front of a building looking concerned, parts of a makeshift shelter behind

props.synopsis: Communities cry out for emergency solutions to a growing homelessness crisis with some residents warning the government that rough sleepers are at risk of dying before homes are built.

title.children: Shelters rejected, shelters destroyed: The search for a roof in regional WA

image.altText: Number plate graphic

props.synopsis: The Queensland grandmother sold her personalised Victorian number plate on Facebook for $270.

title.children: Natalie could lose her driver's licence because of this 'innocent mistake'

image.altText: Rubble lies at a damaged site in Beirut in the aftermath of an air strike

props.synopsis: The news comes a day after the ICC issued an arrest warrant for Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu.

title.children: Four Italian soldiers injured in rocket attack on UNIFIL headquarters in Lebanon, prime minister says

image.altText: A sign at the Women's and Children's Hospital in North Adelaide.

props.synopsis: The number of families who have been paid compensation over SA's cochlear implant programming error has risen to 141.

title.children: Two more families impacted by cochlear implant bungle

image.altText: Henry Heng

props.synopsis: Demand for culturally appropriate aged care is booming as some migrant communities shake the taboo of placing elderly relatives in professional care.

title.children: From lion dances to banh mi, these aged care homes are doing things differently

image.altText: A university graduate wearing a gown and cap is seen outside Parliament House in Canberra

props.synopsis: For most people the policy affects, the timing may not seem critical. But a fraction are owed refunds from the government and still don't have that money in their pockets.

title.children: New HECS laws meant up to 200,000 people could have had refunds in July, but they're still waiting

image.altText: Four Harry Styles wannabes lining up at a lookalike competition with a crown behind them

props.synopsis: Over the past month, a pandemic of look-alike contests have swept the globe, prompting clusters of men with the vaguest resemblances of celebrities to gather in parks.

title.children: From Chalamet to Styles: Why there are so many celebrity look-alike contests everywhere

image.altText: Close-up of musician Kasey Chambers, smiling and framed by her tousled brown hair

props.synopsis: Kasey Chambers's new book is her most candid work yet, tracing her life and career from a kid in the outback to an Australian music household name. She tells us about the challenges of writing, parenting and self-producing her 13th studio album, Backbone.

title.children: Kasey Chambers reflects on her career and how not to be a d***head in new book and album

image.altText: Kendrick Lamar leans in the window of a 1987 Buick GNX wearing backwards blue baseball cap and black leather jacket

props.synopsis: The surprise 12-track release features SZA, Jack Antonoff, Kamasi Washington and references to Lamar’s high-profile feud with Drake.

title.children: Kendrick Lamar follows Drake feud with surpise new album, GNX

image.altText: A close up picture of a fly sitting on top of a bin

props.synopsis: One entomologist says climate change is creating perfecting conditions for fly breeding. Another's not so sure. But they agree that spring has brought an airborne invasion of the pesky insects.

title.children: Flies on the rise? Experts debate mysteries of unwelcome blow-ins

image.altText: A group of Wallabies players in training gear walking on the pitch.

props.synopsis: Harry Potter is handed his Wallabies' Test debut against Scotland with Joseph Suaalii also brought back into the starting line-up.

title.children: Wallabies give wing wizard Harry Potter debut vs Scots

image.altText: Antarctica research

props.synopsis: Hundreds of polar researchers issue an emergency statement calling for urgent action to deal with the impacts of climate change in Antarctica.

title.children: Antarctic researchers warn of possible 'catastrophic' sea level rise within our lifetime
